wikipedia_page.main:
Nicola Varley (born 9 April 1987), known as Envy, is an English rapper/MC.
Envy carved out her own niche in the predominantly male British grime scene with several show-stealing appearances on 'The City Is Ours Music Mixtapes' from Manchester. This led to several collaborations with artists from all over the UK She released her debut solo single, "Tongue Twister", through StopStart Records.Having graduated from Loughborough University with a degree in Media, Envy now concentrates on her music career full-time.

"Her lyrics, if you can hear them (you might need a vari-speed facility), are well smart, with the wry, pithy intelligence of the media-savvy: "I take it tit for tat/I'll take your tacit consent/To turn the Taliban to take over your town… You're lookin' to be loved but can't find a flippin' solution/I'm lost on location, laceratin' as I'm lacin'/Lookin' lovely/Better pray your label pay for elocution," she rapid-fires over the bubblicious grime rhythms, with their shades of Missy's Work It, of previous single Tongue Twister. We're not sure what she means or who the subject is of her ire here, but as ever she sounds fierce yet witty, her staccato delivery popping in time to the buzzing, fizzing synth beat. In fact, so rhythmic is her phrasing that it would sound good acappella, but it works both ways: remove her rhymes and you've got pristine future-perfect electro-pop."

Source:

response: * Envy (born 1987), English rapper and MC

Women have contributed to hip hop's evolution in Britain from the beginning.Chang, Jeff. "Future Shock", "Future Shock", January 2004. Retrieved 14 March 2008. Female British hip hop artists include Alesha Dixon, Baby Blue, Estelle, Lady Leshurr, Lady Sovereign, Little Simz, M.I.A., Monie Love, Nadia Rose, Shystie, No Lay, Stefflon Don, Mercury prize winners Ms. Dynamite and Speech Debelle and music producer Mizz Beats. Other British female rappers have included Cookie Crew, She Rockers, Wee Papa Girl Rappers, NoLay, C-Mone and Envy.
Envy is an emotion that is also one of the seven deadly sins.

*Envy, Switzerland
*Envy, United States Virgin Islands
*Envy (novel) (Zavist'), a 1927 novel by Yuri Olesha
*Envy, a Fullmetal Alchemist character
*Envy (2004 film), a comedy film
*Envy (2009 film), a Turkish film
*Envy (English rapper) (born 1987)
*Envy (band), a Japanese post-hardcore band
*DJ Envy (born 1977), an American DJ and radio personality
*Nico & Vinz or Envy, a Norwegian hip-hop duo
* Envy, American band consisting of Rhonni and Gina Stile
*Green With Envy is an album by British rapper Tion Wayne
*Envy (Eve's Plum album) (1993)
*Envy (Ambitious Lovers album) (1984)
*"Envy" (song), a song by Ash
*"Envy", a song appearing on Lunch. Drunk. Love. by Bowling For Soup
*"Envy" (movie theme song), a movie theme by Dan Navarro, from the 2004 film Envy
*Envy (apple), a trademarked brand of the Scilate apple variety, a cross between Royal Gala and Braeburn
*Envy (dinghy), a type of fibreglass sailing dinghy
*HP Envy, a line of laptops by Hewlett-Packard
*Team Envy or Team EnVyUs, an international eSports organization based in the United States
*VIA Envy, a sound chip

In May 2011, he released his second LP, The Life Equation. The album is co-produced with Stephen Hague and features collaborations with Gruff Rhys (of Super Furry Animals) and Envy. Akira often produced his own videos. In 2013, Akira performed at Grant Morrison's MorrisonCon.

Akira has produced songs for a number of artists including two top forty hits for Lethal Bizzle along with songs for Newham Generals' Footsie, Big Narstie, Envy, G-Mane, Littles, Marvin The Martian, Issue, and Time.

Mz. Bratt has also appeared on remixes and records with other artists including Wiley, Taio Cruz, Sadie Ama, Dionne Bromfield and Jazmine Sullivan. A remix of Tinchy Stryder's "Game Over" was promoted online in November 2010 under the name "Female Takeover Remix", with the female MCs Ruff Diamondz, Envy, Lioness, Cherri V, Baby Blue, A.Dot, Lady Leshurr, RoXXXan and Mz. Bratt.
! scope="row"| "Game Over – Female Takeover"(Tinchy Stryder featuring Ruff Diamondz, Amplify Dot, Envy, CherriV, BabyBlue, RoxXxan, Lioness, Mz Bratt and Lady Leshurr)

Losers formed in 2007 as the remix project of Temple-Morris and Bellamy. They released their first album, "Beautiful Losers", in September 2010. The first single "Flush", featuring rappers Riz MC and Envy, received coverage from the music press and the BBC.
